column4: http://ubuntuusers.de/paste/18750/ shows a log of my restart. Why does the dmesg time stamp jump in line 59 from [ 0.000000]  suddenly to [ 18.110675]?
because time is a relative construct?
or maybe because after 18 seconds give or take, the klogd is started and extracts data from the kernel log ringbuffer into userspace
Since the days of Einstein time is a relative coordinate. Still it does not jump.
